intro: Pseudodicliptera longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved false dicliptera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. Its flowers are clustered in small inflorescences and are usually white or pale green, with four to five petals. The plant is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests or along stream banks.
